reviews.review_msg: Actual beast. Loved his lectures, very entertaining and along with working harder in the second half, I was able to revive my grade when he started lecturing. Lots of practice was required to understand the material, but it builds off each other. Reading the textbook prior to lecture will help immensely

Warren is an overall good prof. Tons of examples in class. IF you are not good at chem, I HIGHLY suggest reading the textbook and doing the examples. Understanding fundamental concepts conceptually and being able to explain them is ALSO a must for the midterm/final. GO to his office hours and ask as many questions as you can.

The course was difficult, and I had to retake it in order to pass. My second time around I committed to getting a GOOD tutor, going to ALL the office hours, and doing LOTS of practice problems. Jeff Warren is  nice and made getting help really accessible and I looked forward to having chats with him during office hours. Use all the resources given!

Jeff is the best chem prof ever. He made lectures interesting and offered the class solid advice often. His final was fair as long as you practice. Jeff was always available during office hours and I recommend you go as they are fun and informative. He explained anything I need re-enforcement on and would work practice problems with me if needed!
Lecture material relevant to exam. Very engaging lecturer. Reading the textbook before lectures will add to the lecture and learning experience, please do it. Could not recommend him more.

Warren himself was a good professor, I just found the topics covered in Chem 120 very hard. Warren's jokes were a great mood lightener during lectures and he had a way of making some topics interesting. The demos were great. When he took over my grades went up and I believe it's because his teaching style worked better for me than Leznoff.

Dr. Warren was fantastic, always cracking jokes, and explaining why the chemistry we were learning was important in a variety of different fields. He did some great demos, that I won't spoil for those taking a class with him in the future, that helped you understand the material. If you want to do well, study the practice questions in the textbook!

Prof Warren is hands down one of the funniest profs I've ever had. Even though this was a ridiculously challenging class, Jeff somehow made it seem less intimidating and scary. He goes over the content really well and also adds his own funny wits to it to make the class funny and enjoyable (not to mention he also blows up balloons in class)
He's good that's all you need to know

Very engaging lecturer, knows how to draw people in, charismatic. Also very engaging and helpful during office hours, highly recommend going to it if you can. His video lectures are also very well made so if you miss lectures you can still catch up just as well. Pay attention to his instructions during exams or you'll be subjected to his wrath.

GOAT. Professor Warren has the best lectures. Although he teaches chemistry, which is pretty difficult and hard to understand, he always finds ways to make it interesting. One of the best profs I've had so far, he's really helpful at the office hours, and has the best demos during class. Also posts worked examples and videos on canvas.

Likes to tell jokes but nobody laughs at it. But don't get me wrong, he is enthusiastic with chem and is willing to solve any problem. I went to his office hours and he is so patient to teach me (and he has many students!) His class is also very interesting, he made chem fun!

Love prof Warren. He genuinely cares about his students. Hell answer all your questions during office hours and will do so until you fully understand. Hes very down to earth and has a great sense of humor. Youll do great if you practice until you no longer need the formula sheet, understand all concepts fully and complete all lon capas on time.

He loves memes and jokes a lot so that made online class a bit fun. Content is difficult so understand the material don't go off memorizing the notes because the concepts are what you need to understand for the final and some calculations. He's a really chillz prof and communicates with the class well.

Probably best professor Ive had so far. Loved his lectures as they were entertaining and short. Posted solutions to his practice final which many other profs havent done. Overall would definitely recommend him to others just make sure youre on top of your work from day 1
Tough course, but prof was great! I felt like I learned a lot from him.
His lectures were very short, straightforward and easy to follow if you read the readings he had assigned. This was hard class and I found him to be good at teaching difficult material.

Warren is a solid prof! His lectures are simple and to the point (he also sprinkles in jokes too!). Definitely recommend doing lots of practice problems and reading the textbook to get a solid understanding of the material because the class isnt easy!
Hes a solid prof

Prof Warren was fine, but not amazing. He taught well enough, and tried to add some entertainment into the lectures. My least favourite part of the class was not being allowed to see what you did wrong on tests and quizzes.

Prof Warren may the best prof I have had at SFU. He's hilarious and great at teaching the course material. I found his half of the course easier than the first half. His office hours were extremely useful. The final seemed easier than the midterm. Take this course with Warren and Leznoff if you have the chance!

Prof Warren taught the second half of my chem120 course. He clearly cares about his students, and offered us tons of practice problems with worked-out solutions. Some quizzes were quite difficult. This is a hard class, and practicing LonCapa, provided materials, and textbook worked examples are the best ways to prepare for quizzes and exams.

Prof Warren truly is a real gem. The kind things I could say about this man are really off the charts. He's incredibly kind, and very funny, as well as being incredibly capable as a professor. I don't think I've ever been more excited for a class as I have this one. Biggest thing: GO TO OFFICE HOURS!!! Office hours are a WICKED good time.

Chem 120 was split between two profs and I'd say Warren's half of the semester was just barely the worse half. He's good at explaining concepts but he tried to make his lecture videos under 10 minutes so I feel like there werent enough examples to really solidify the concepts. He's a really fun guy and you gotta love his hashtags during lectures.

Leznoff is a great prof he is super enthusiastic and his lectures are pretty clear. HOWEVER his lectures are not enough especially if you're not good at chemistry. I HIGHLY suggest reading the textbook, and doing the examples, redoing the LON-CAPA questions multiple times over after doing them, and UNDERSTANDING the fundamental concepts. Good luck

Prof Leznoff is the best. He embodies a mad scientist in the best way. His lectures were a little bit slow, but there was always a couple jokes thrown in. He really likes the history what we were learning and I found that helps with my understanding of course concepts. His exam was really fair, just make sure to practice. Go to his office hours

Even though the course was extremely difficult, he still did an incredible job at teaching. He did do a lot of examples that he told us are important for exams. His teaching material did help me understand everything a lot more which made it easier to do those questions. I think it was just too much material ngl but it was very interesting.

I loved Dr. Leznoff, his lectures were super engaging, and he always made himself available outside class during his office hours where he was excited to help students. I loved his enthusiasm about all the topics he covered, and the way he clearly explained everything. If you want to do well, get the textbook and practice the questions in the book!

Made CHEM120/121 seem a lot less scary than other people made it out to be. He's a great prof and explains everything very thoroughly. I highly recommend doing as many practice problems in the textbook as you can because lectures alone will not help you do well in this class. His exam questions are very similar to textbook questions.

One of the most caring and inspiring professors ever. Made me fall in love with chemistry and rethink my major/future/ Highly recommend attending lectures in person, he is engaging, funny, and exudes enthusiasm.  Go to tutorials. Lectures are theory-based, you need tutorials for problem-solving strategies.

Dr. Leznoff is one of the best profs I've had so far. Lectures were interesting and you could tell he has a strong passion for chemistry, especially with his outfits matching the lecture content. Lon capa quizzes and assignments were hard, but the demos were pretty cool and the lectures were too good to skip.
the most enthusiastic professor i've ever met. very nice and funny.

One of my favourite profs, he's so passionate about chemistry and makes class fun. Also explains concepts clearly and repeats things that are important/are likely to show up on exams. I'd definitely take another course with him.
Leznoff is great! However his lectures can range from 30 minutes to over an hour. He says a lot of things that you don't necessarily need to know either.

I hate this prof. he legit throws so much information at you in one single lecture and doesn't even explain things. the midterm was similar to the practice and youtube videos really helped me succeed. FINAL EXAM WAS DEATH it was all conceptual stuff from the notes and nothing like the practice so that threw me off. online lectures were 1.5 hr each
Very good prof, he makes learning chemistry not a nightmare

Extremely passionate about chemistry and his enthusiasm is more contagious than the cold. Listening to his lectures was not as painful as someone would expect from a chem lecture. Just stay caught up, because there is so much to learn. A minor inconvenience is that you can't see your quiz results, only the mark itself.

Prof Leznoff was fine, but not amazing. He taught well enough, although the lectures weren't super entertaining, in my opinion. My least favourite part of the class was not being allowed to see what you did wrong on tests and quizzes.

Prof Leznoff is great. He has so much passion and enthusiasm towards the course material. His lectures are very long and heavy on material. I would say his half of the course was a little harder than the second half. The midterm was hard so make sure to do a lot of practice problems.

Prof Leznoff is awesome, his lectures may be long but he does a great job explaining everything. It's clear watching his lectures that he has a passion for teaching and the 'extra' videos he posts are so fun to watch. Keep a note of the questions he points out during lectures, that he hints at because they do show up.

His lectures were prerecorded in my case, and I could tell he is very passionate, does well in explaining the material and makes it interesting. There is weekly quizzes and homework on top of three lectures a week so if you fall behind, you can't submit a late assignment and it's difficult to catch up.

Prof. Leznoff was awesome. His lectures can be a bit boring, but when he speaks about Chem you can really see how much he loves it. His passion and enthusiasm towards Chemistry really made the course exceptional, and a joy despite its difficulty. Though you're not required to, I recommend reading the textbook because it expands on a lot of topics!

Prof Leznoff taught the first half of my chem120 course. Pre-recorded lectures were long but engaging, as he clearly loves what he does. Quizzes were quite difficult considering they're based on LonCapa. NO quiz feedback was given, even with a failing grade on it. Midterm was fair, with some questions copied from homework and the practice exam.
Dr. Leznoff loves chemistry and that shows through his teaching. His lectures are very engaging as he is quite humourous. Chemistry can easily be seen as boring, but he makes it really enjoyable.

One of my favourite profs! Was great at explaining concepts and then showing how to apply with examples in lecture! Was so approachable and kind and just generally cared about his students. Definitely try to take Chem with him! Way better experience than with other professors!

His lectures are clear. His explanations are clear. His feedback towards our quizzes/tests are clear. He's easy to reach. The exams questions matches to what he taught, with some hard questions to separate the 'A' students. Overall, if you go to his lectures, you should be able to pass easily.

I took chemistry 120 with Leznoff and Warren failed took it with Gary and got a b-. Professor Mund by FAR was a better professor he did TONS of examples in class and based his class down to the t on the textbook which you should DEFINITELY Invest your time in to do well in the course. If you are decided which chem prof to use i HIGHLY suggest him.

He doesn't teach, he just gives homework. He gives lab instructions and some observations which you have to do then write a lab for. There are no videos or any classes for you to watch and attend. The lab feedback is given by TAs who don't always offer the best feedback. Theres also LONCAPA homework.
Best prof i've had so far Im ussually terrible at chem yet i am getting a B- or B in the course!!
He posts all the notes, relatively easy quizes. Although his notes can be too generally to understand, but its all good

Great teacher!  Very helpful and patient.  Willing to help his students anytime.  He is the best Chem teacher I had.  Conveys material very clearly.  Difficult materials, especially for someone who is really weak in chemistry, but Dr. Mund is always available for help.
Overall, great prof. He's very helpful and explains concepts well.  I would definitely recommend him.

You have to take chemistry with Garry. he is definitely the most clear, organized, helpful prof i have met so far not mentioning he is super nice and patient. He extended 40min office hour for me just because i haven't quiet got the question. His exam is fair, just go to lecture and tutorial and do the practice and you will be fine. Great guy!

Doesn't particularly treat students well.  Reputedly treats them better once in the third or fourth year courses, but after the first year course, I was already quite discouraged from proceeding onto further courses with this guy.
Would rather be doing research, and he tells his students this.
No Comments
No Comments
I love chemistry but this teacher made me hate it

Lectures started off good, kind of devolved into random off-topic subjects within the first few weeks. Midterms are pretty close to the quizzes, she even pops in a couple super easy questions for free marks basically. Lon capa is horrendous though, and the textbook questions are insanely hard after chapter 3. Be prepared to self study a lot.
doesn't actually teach material, tells random personal anecdotes. showed up half an hour late to midterm exam leaving us with only a half hour to do the exam.

Goyan was the most caring professor I've ever had! Lectures and practice problems recorded, which helped a lot. She answered every single student's question, and gave so much time if you asked for it. I took this course 3 times, passed with her. Says it all. I couldn't believe the other reviews, made an account just to say how fantastic she is.

absolutely diabolical. Literally went to vegas the week of our first midterm and didnt answer any emails and cancelled lectures during that week. extremely unorganized. grades always turned in super late so you cant even use them to prepare for next test. no. just no.

Dr Goyan is an okay lecturer. She will explain the material and go on the occasional tangent on some chemistry fact. The course itself covers a lot of material and can become very difficult if you fall behind. If you do all the homework it isn't as bad. The midterm is 40% and final 45%. Dr G gets "creative" with her tests, so beware.
She's a a nice person, but not the best teacher. We were expected to learn a lot if not everything outside of class.

Absolute worst instructor you can have. She skipped like 4 lectures and expected us to learn the material on our own. She makes so many mistakes in lectures and even in pre recorded ones. Spends 60 percent of the lecture blabbering about random stuff. She made mistakes on the midterm and gave no extra time. Whatever you do, avoid her at all costs!!
basically have to teach yourself everything
Super nice prof, pop quizzes sometimes before the lab, and don't forget your sig figs! Grading is pretty clear and you just have to average 50% on your lab write ups to pass the class.

The fact that you get absolutely zero feedback from all the assignments, quizzes and term tests makes it impossible to plan and improve. Add to that the horrendous loncapa portal + lack of overall structure in this course are designed to make you feel lost. Avoid at all costs I couldn't take this course with Jeff because it was full I know now why
Her notes are helpful,exams are not that hard.However,ENJOY THE SLEEP IN HER CLASS

Nice guy, did do a lot of experiments and made class interesting.  Deffinately didn't walk you through every little thing, and only did brief power point presentations so you do have to do work on your own time.

Charismatic guy... lectures are very entertaining because of the experiments and explosions, but he doesn't cover the material in depth, PPTs are basically a skim through the textbook. I had to rely on the fact that I took the AP equivalent in high school to get a decent mark on the midterm.

A super British soccer fans - MAN-U !! I always wonder that if he would make the test more difficult when Man-U loses.....haha...anyways.......super interesting experiements in EACH LEC.  .......u won't fall asleeep fore sure......tests are based on theories more than calculations....WATCH OUT !
m/c midterms all about  exceptions  in rules. memorise 'em all!
almost the whole class sleep during lecture
No Comments
No Comments

If you don't read the textbook before going to class, you better not go. He makes the lecture material more confusing and hard to understand. His notes are not too useful. The MT was fair. Now I just read the textbook myself to learn, and borrowed my friend's notes. I don't like going to his lectures anymore.

He seems to know his stuff inside and out, but he's a TERRIBLE lecturer! Doesn't know how to keep students awake and interested. But then again, it's kind of hard to top Holdcroft off... (the prof for the first half of the course)
monotone voice, rep. hand movement, staring down students, bad at explaining
No Comments
John is a painfully average prof. His midterm was easy and final was hard. His weekly quizzes were only marked out of 5, so they were super easy to lose marks on and some of the questions were weird.
